description: Mobile techniques used by CHEMISTGAMES, ATT&CK software S0555 (v1.0)
name: CHEMISTGAMES (S0555)

techniques.comment: [CHEMISTGAMES](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0555) has used HTTPS for C2 communication.(Citation: CYBERWARCON CHEMISTGAMES)
[CHEMISTGAMES](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0555) can run bash commands.(Citation: CYBERWARCON CHEMISTGAMES)
[CHEMISTGAMES](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0555) can collect files from the filesystem and account information from Google Chrome.(Citation: CYBERWARCON CHEMISTGAMES)
[CHEMISTGAMES](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0555) can download new modules while running.(Citation: CYBERWARCON CHEMISTGAMES)
[CHEMISTGAMES](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0555) has used HTTPS for C2 communication.(Citation: CYBERWARCON CHEMISTGAMES)
[CHEMISTGAMES](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0555) has collected the device’s location.(Citation: CYBERWARCON CHEMISTGAMES)
[CHEMISTGAMES](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0555) has masqueraded as popular South Korean applications.(Citation: CYBERWARCON CHEMISTGAMES)
[CHEMISTGAMES](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0555) has utilized native code to decrypt its malicious payload.(Citation: CYBERWARCON CHEMISTGAMES)
[CHEMISTGAMES](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0555) has encrypted its DEX payload.(Citation: CYBERWARCON CHEMISTGAMES)

[CHEMISTGAMES](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0555) has been distributed as updates to legitimate applications. This was accomplished by compromising legitimate app developers, and subsequently gaining access to their Google Play Store developer account.(Citation: CYBERWARCON CHEMISTGAMES)
[CHEMISTGAMES](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0555) has fingerprinted devices to uniquely identify them.(Citation: CYBERWARCON CHEMISTGAMES)
